intro: Pistolochia gorodkovii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
